total_revenue.notes: Cloud and AI strength offset macro uncertainty

operating_income.notes: Operating margin expanded to 46% as operating expenses grew only 2%

net_income.notes: Includes favorable other income and derivatives gains

highlights: Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services +11% (14% CC)
Microsoft 365 Commercial cloud +12% (15% CC) driven by E5 and Copilot ARPU growth
Consumer cloud +10% (12% CC) after the January price increase
Dynamics products and cloud services +11% (13% CC) with Dynamics 365 +16% (18% CC)
Server products and cloud services +22% (24% CC)
Azure and other cloud services +33% (35% CC) including 16 points from AI services
Azure AI outperformance driven by pulled-forward capacity while non-AI enterprise demand strengthened
Search and news advertising ex-TAC +21% (23% CC)

Azure_AI_services.notes: AI services accounted for 16 points of Azure growth as capacity came online faster

capital_expenditures.notes: Slightly below expectations due to delivery timing; cash paid for PP&E $16.7B
capital_expenditures.mix: Roughly half long-lived assets and half servers GPUs/CPUs tied to customer backlog

infrastructure: Opened data centers in 10 countries this quarter and reduced dock-to-live GPU lead times by nearly 20%
Azure supply chain performance improved GPU and AI performance by ~$30% while halving cost per token
data_and_ai: Fabric surpassed 21,000 paid customers with 50% using three or more workloads and OneLake data grew 6x YoY
Foundry now runs 100 trillion tokens per quarter, supports 70,000 enterprises, and added new models from OpenAI, Cohere, DeepSeek, Meta, Mistral, Stability
developer_tools_and_power_platform: GitHub Copilot users grew to 15M (4x YoY), introduced agent modes like Autofix and code review agents, and previewed an asynchronous SWE agent
Visual Studio/VS Code reach 50M MAUs; Power Platform users 56M (+27%) with increasing AI features
productivity_and_agents: Microsoft 365 Copilot seats tripled YoY, introduced new role-based agents and deep reasoning/agent flows, and customers built 1M custom agents this quarter
Dynamics 365 gained share with customers like Avaya and Brunswick, and Dragon Copilot handled 9.5M physician encounters (+50% QoQ)
consumer_and_edge: Copilot+ PCs expanded with AI experiences like Recall, Click to Do, Windows Search, and Windows 11 deployments rose ~75% YoY
LinkedIn members exceeded 1B, video watch time +36%, upskill coaching usage +2x QoQ, and premium SMB page subscribers surged 75% QoQ
Bing/Edge search innovations (Copilot Vision, Copilot Discover) helped maintain ad share gains and push trailing 12-month advertising revenue beyond $20B
security_and_gaming: Security Copilot agents leverage 84 trillion threat signals; Entra now has >900M MAUs and 1.4M security customers with 4+ workloads
Gaming reached 500M monthly active users, cloud gaming hit 150M hours, Xbox Play Anywhere spans 1,000+ games, and Copilot for Gaming offers live assistance

q4_guidance.Productivity_and_Business_Processes: Revenue $32.05B to $32.35B (+11-12% CC); M365 commercial cloud ~14% CC; consumer cloud mid-teens; LinkedIn high-single digits; Dynamics mid-to-high teens.
q4_guidance.Intelligent_Cloud: Revenue $28.75B to $29.05B (+20-22% CC); Azure growth 34-35% CC with expected non-AI strength and some AI capacity constraints beyond June; on-prem servers decline mid-single digits; Enterprise/Partner Services mid-to-high single digits.
q4_guidance.More_Personal_Computing: Revenue $12.35B to $12.85B; Windows OEM/devices down mid-to-high single digits; Search and news advertising ex-TAC high teens; overall search mid-teens; gaming revenue mid-single digits with Xbox content/services high-single digit growth.

longer_term.capex: FY26 spend will grow at a lower rate with a higher mix of short-lived assets more closely tied to revenue while preserving fungibility.
longer_term.no_change: H2 CapEx guidance from January remains intact despite sequential increase in Q4.

metadata.source: Microsoft FY 2025 Q3 earnings release and transcript
